TopicTitle: [WIP][1.9.x-1.12.x] Scatterer-atmospheric scattering (0.0838 - 14/08/2022) Scattering improvements, in-game atmo generation and multi-sun support

Articles.Content:
I have installed Scatterer 324 in  my <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr> KSP 1.3.1 and ALWAYSs in at 140Km the atmosphere vanishes, and comes back further depending on the camera position and direction.  

I am using clouds from RSSVE-lite, but RSSVE for the atmosphere and scatterer configs. (disabled volumetrics, cityLights and terrain additions from config located on main RSSVE folder   - also deleted terrain, clouds and cityLights folders)  

I've seen that others have had this issue and maybe someone knows how to fix it so maybe someone can help?  

outputlog: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/ljpsx4qdpw4iath/output_log.txt?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/ljpsx4qdpw4iath/output_log.txt?dl=0)

Video demonstration:

<iframe allowfullscreen="true" frameborder="0" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/QGhapFvnYV0?feature=oembed" width="480"></iframe>

**Edited <time datetime="2018-06-30T20:52:52Z" title="06/30/2018 08:52  PM" data-short="6 yr">June 30, 2018</time> by Agustin**

Installed 320b and fixed it. Though I have a problem that seems to keep happening from time to time. It is the ground textures dissapearing on reentry. Maybe warping i dont know. But they reapper only when very close to the ground. The water is seen instead.

edit:

Launching with glcore or dx11 was causing the terrain missing glitch. Luckily textures unlimited sorks without them on 1.3.1. <abbr title="Real Solar System (mod)">RSS</abbr>/<abbr title="Realism Overhaul (mod)">RO</abbr> WITH NICE GRAPHICS WORKING EVEN QITH LAST PARINCIPIA update sorking oh.... time to play now.... actually ive already been playing around and made a few satelite contracts already. Everything looks niiiiiiice ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif ":)")

**Edited <time datetime="2018-07-01T23:52:54Z" title="07/01/2018 11:52  PM" data-short="6 yr">July 1, 2018</time> by SparkyFox**

> 
> 
> 15 hours ago, Pavel ☭ said:
> 
> 
> On a similar note, for some reason EVERY SINGLE TIME I start the game I have to go into Eve and click apply or else I get awful frame drops; the volumetric clouds view distance value is still really low as I set it last time, but I have to "reapply" it every time I enter the game. Help?
> 

That's got nothing to do with Scatterer, That's part of <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr>, the stock configs in <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> can be laggy, use SVE or something similar instead

> 
> 
> On 7/1/2018 at 4:49 AM, Pavel ☭ said:
> 
> 
> On a similar note, for some reason EVERY SINGLE TIME I start the game I have to go into Eve and click apply or else I get awful frame drops; the volumetric clouds view distance value is still really low as I set it last time, but I have to "reapply" it every time I enter the game. Help?
> 

Your game is likely suffering from a reaction to the scatterer-<abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> integration, which disables when you reapply an <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> config ingame but re-enables when you exit to menu and start a save again. Try disabling scatterer integration with <abbr title="Environmental Visual Enhancement (mod)">EVE</abbr> in the main menu GUI.

I'm actually using spectra right now. Without scatterer it was running fine but now I can barely play and usually have to deal with 20-25 FPS. Please don't tell me to get a new computer.

I am using RSSVE 1.3.1-5 with scatterer 0.320b, and I'm having an issue where the earth becomes transparent and the skybox behind it is briefly visible, at an altitude of arround 100km

[http://imgur.com/gallery/6tBjaum](http://imgur.com/gallery/6tBjaum)
